metadata.Title: CVE-2007-4559 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the (1) extract and (2) extractallfunctions in the tarfile module in Python allows user-assisted remoteattackers to overwrite arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) sequence infilenames in a TAR archive, a related issue to CVE-2001-1267.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2007-4559` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.11 - 3.11.6-1
libpython3.11 - 3.11.6-1
libpython3.11-minimal - 3.11.6-1
libpython3.11-stdlib - 3.11.6-1
libpython3.11-testsuite - 3.11.6-1
python3.11 - 3.11.6-1
python3.11-examples - 3.11.6-1
python3.11-full - 3.11.6-1
python3.11-minimal - 3.11.6-1
python3.11-nopie - 3.11.6-1
python3.11-venv - 3.11.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.11 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.6-1').
